DataElement.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Procedure Negation Ability Discontinue Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related to the patientÂ’s inability to discontinue therapy as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Procedure Negation Ability Discontinue Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient unable to disconti
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue treatment with ototoxic or nephrotoxic medications at least 7 days before first dose of carboplatin and for the duration of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require treatment with a RANKL inhibitor (e.g., denosumab) and is unable to discontinue it prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require treatment with a RANKL inhibitor (e.g., denosumab) and is unable to discontinue it before initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant H2 blockers or proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) prior to starting M3814 and avelumab on day 7 and greater than or equal to 5 days prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient requiring concomitant use of proton pump inhibitors and unable to stop 5 days prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require treatment with a receptor activator of nuclear factor kappa-B ligand (RANKL) inhibitor (e.g. denosumab) that cannot be discontinued before treatment with atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant use of CYP3A4/5 substrates with a narrow therapeutic index?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) greater than or equal to 5 days or 5 elimination half-lives (whichever is shorter) prior to the first dose of M3814?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) greater than or equal to 5 days prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant medications or herbal supplements that are strong inhibitors or strong inducers of cytochrome P450 (CYP) isoenzymes CYP3A4/5, CYP2C19, and CYP2C9 or concomitant use of CYP3A4/5 substrates with a narrow therapeutic index within the timelines specified in section 3.2.8?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) while taking M1774?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) prior to starting M3814 and avelumab and greater than or equal to 5 days prior to starting M3814 and avelumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant medications or herbal supplements that are strong inhibitors or strong inducers of cytochrome P450 (CYP) isoenzymes CYP1A2, CYP3A4/5, CYP2C19, and CYP2C9 or concomitant use of hMATE1, hMATE2, and CYP3A4/5 substrates with a narrow therapeutic index within the timelines specified in section 3.2.8?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.21 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002642. ak 2023.5.3 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002390. ak
